title: Authorizes the West Islip union free school district to file an application for real property tax exemption on a parcel acquired on May 4, 2004
summary: Authorizes the West Islip union free school district to file an application with the assessor of the town of Islip for a real property tax exemption on a certain parcel for the 2007-2008 and 2008-2009 assessment rolls.

       Introduced  by  Sen. JOHNSON -- read twice and ordered printed, and when

       AN ACT to authorize the West Islip union free school district to file an
         application with the assessor of the town of Islip for a real property
         tax exemption on a certain parcel

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the assessor of
    2  the  town  of  Islip  is hereby authorized to accept from the West Islip
    3  union free school district applications for exemption from real property
    4  tax pursuant to section 408  of  the  real  property  tax  law  for  the
    5  2007-2008  and  2008-2009 assessment rolls for the parcels owned by such
    6  school district which is located in the town of  Islip  at  O  Boulevard
    7  Avenue, West Islip, otherwise known as: district 500, section 336, block
    8  200,  lot 49.   If accepted, such application shall be reviewed as if it
    9  had been received on or before the taxable status date  established  for
   10  such rolls.
   11    If  satisfied that such school district would otherwise be entitled to
   12  such exemption if such school district  had  filed  an  application  for
   13  exemption  by  the  appropriate taxable status date, the assessor of the
   14  town of Islip, upon approval by the town board of such town,  may  grant
   15  exemption  from all taxation beginning on the date of conveyance of such
   16  parcel to such school district on the effective date  of  this  act  and
   17  cancel  taxes,  fines, penalties and interest remaining unpaid, and make
   18  appropriate corrections of the subject rolls.
   19    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2637

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to authorize the West Islip union free school district to file an
application with the assessor of the town of Islip
for a real property tax exemption on a certain parcel

PURPOSE:
Authorizes the West Islip union free school district to file an
application for real property lax exemption on a parcel acquired by
the school district from the County of Suffolk.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Authorizes the assessor of the town of Islip to accept from the West
Islip union free school district an application for exemption from
real property tax pursuant to section 408 of the real property tax
law for the 2007-2008 and 2008-200g assessment rolls, for the parcel
conveyed to such school district by the County of Suffolk, with such
parcel being located in the town of Islip at 0 Boulevard Avenue, West
Islip, otherwise known as: district 500, section 336, block 200, lot
49.

EXISTING LAW:
Existing law authorizes lax exemptions be granted after the taxable
status date has passed if a bill is chaptered authorizing an assessor
to accept a late application.

JUSTIFICATION:
The West Islip Union Free School District was
conveyed a parcel of land from the County of Suffolk at
Boulevard Avenue, West Islip on April 1, 2006, for school-related
use and as such should be exempt from property taxes.
The property was acquired by the County of Suffolk through a tax
foreclosure in May, 2004, and real property taxes of record for the
2007-2008 and 2008-2009 tax rolls are currently due.  The additional
cost of paying the property taxes would be detrimental to the school
district's funds and the community it serves.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
S.4410-A: 2009 - Referred to Local Government
          2010 - Passed Senate

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None to the state.  The town would waive taxes and penalty.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This Act shall take effect immediately.
